description: Simple, clean and works very well on Fedora 35
I've found my app for notetaking on linux. Extremely clean. All of the good things I like in OneNote with none of the downsides or features I would never use.

You cannot add images.
You cannot change background color or font
there is nothing in preferences except 2 toggle.

It has lot of potential.
I was trying to find something where i can input text and images and write on them with a stylus -- just like one note.
really nice app to store notes

summary: Could not use it, tried moving one note under the other and nothing

description: The idea is nice but this is so so far away from being a stable useable program. Looks like someones early attempts in GTK programming. Just try to use images and you find out how weak this program is.
summary: It is a version 0.2 and might not get version 0.3

description: Promising. Had issues with handwriting, because it detected my palm. Didn't figure out yet, how to change font to bold or any other style. Couldn't insert pictures. So, still quite raw and rudimentary, but definitly worth testing.
A great notetaking app for all Markdown-lovers and OneNote-users!
Constantly crash, not support finger writing. Can't create new note. It does not look like the screens in the app store
summary: Constantly crash, not support finger writing
